snippet: Women are increasingly asserting their rights against the traditions of forced marriage and parental authority, challenging one of the most powerful institutions in Pakistani society.
abstract: Pakistani women are increasingly asserting their rights against traditions of forced marriage and parental authority, challenging one of the most powerful institutions in their society, even at great risk to their lives; some form of arranged marriage still remains the most common way for Pakistanis to find spouses.
lead_paragraph: Women are increasingly asserting their rights against the traditions of forced marriage and parental authority, challenging one of the most powerful institutions in Pakistani society.

headline.seo: Some Pakistani Women Risk All to Marry for Love
headline.main: Defying Parents, Some Pakistani Women Risk All to Marry Whom They Choose
headline.print_headline: Defying Parents, Some Pakistani Women Risk All to Marry Whom They Choose
